title: Japan Fast Facts
subtitle: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Japan and learn more about the country of islands located off the eastern coast of mainland Asia.
content: Here's a look at Japan, a country of islands located off the eastern coast of mainland Asia.377,915 sq km 124,687,293 (July 2021 est.)48.6 years (2020 est.) Tokyo Japanese 98.1%, Koreans 0.4%, Chinese 0.5%, other 1%  Shintoism 70.4%, Buddhism 69.8%, Christianity 1.5%, other 6.9% (Many practice both Shintoism and Buddhism) 2.36% (2019 est.)Japan is a with a constitutional monarchy.Four large islands: Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku and Kyushu, account for about 98% of the country's land area.Japanese society dates back to the Jomon period circa 300 BC.Following an economic boom after , Japan has been stuck in stagnation and deflation since the 1990s.Japan is ruled under the feudal system of the shogun (military commanders); the emperors of Japan were figureheads.The Meiji Restoration, when Japan returns to the direct imperial rule that began circa 660 BC.The modernization of Japan, the formation of political parties, the national assembly, the cabinet and the constitution.China and Japan fight a nine-month war. Japan wins, China gives up Taiwan. and Japan go to war. The war is over by 1905, Japan wins. During , Japan enters on the side of the allies and gains territory in the Pacific at the end of the war.Japan invades China. The conflict continues through , ending with the Japanese defeat in 1945.Japan attacks Pearl Harbor in Hawaii, hoping to destroy the US Pacific fleet.   The first atomic bomb is dropped on Hiroshima. A second atomic bomb is dropped on Nagasaki.. Japan agrees to end the war. Japan signs the formal surrender aboard the USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay. The Occupation of Japan. The country is under the control of the Allied nations, the United States, Great Britain, China and the Soviet Union.Joins the Tokyo hosts the The  take place in Sapporo, Hokkaido prefecture, Japan.becomes emperor after the death of Hirohito.that accepts Japan's responsibility for recruiting  before and during World War II and extends "its sincere apologies and remorse." The 6.9 magnitude Kobe  occurs, where 5,502 people were killed and 36,896 people were injured. A religious cult spreads, a nerve gas, in the Tokyo subway. Twelve people are killed and more than 5,000 are sickened.Nagano hosts the Winter Olympics.Co-hosts the  with South Korea.The first defense ministry since World War II is approved by the parliament. A 9.1 magnitude  takes place 231 miles northeast of Tokyo. The earthquake causes a  with 30 ft. waves that damage several nuclear reactors in the area. The combined total of confirmed deaths and missing is more than 22,000 (nearly 20,000 deaths and 2,500 missing). (Source: )The uninhabited islands, known in Japan as Senkaku and in China as Diaoyu, Tokyo is  to host the 2020 Summer Games. announces that  Previously, Japan's Self-Defense Forces (SDF) could only act if Japan itself was directly threatened. The win gives Abe four more years to institute his policies aimed at reviving Japan's economy by flooding the market with cash, encouraging corporations to create more jobs and increasing government spending. -- a major shift after seven decades of pacifism. The 148-90 vote is the final hurdle for the measures, which will go into effect within roughly the next six months.Japan and South Korea announce that an  a term that describes sex slaves used by the Japanese military during World War II. Japanese Foreign Minister Fumio Kishida says his government will give 1 billion yen ($8.3 million) to a fund to help those who suffered.Abe announces that . , who has already assumed some of his father's duties, will take on the role on May 1, 2019, becoming the 126th Emperor to ascend to Japan's Chrysanthemum Throne.At least 220 people are killed when heavy rain causes flooding and landslides throughout southwest Japan (source: ). Emperor Akihito  during a ceremony in Tokyo. He will now be known as Emperor Emeritus Akihito. The following day,   Naruhito's ascension signals the start of the "Reiwa" era. The attack took place near a park in the city of Kawasaki, about 13 miles from Tokyo, authorities said. after a man burns down a renowned animation studio in Kyoto. The suspect, Shinji Aoba, is injured in the attack. Abe  after polls indicate his party has won a majority of seats in the upper house of Parliament.   begins a four day tour of Japan.  - Abe and the IOC . It is also announced that the event will still be dubbed Tokyo 2020 despite the postponement. - A Japanese court recognizes , clearing the way for them to receive medical benefits just days before the 75th anniversary of the attack.- Abe resigns as prime minister, .-  is .

title: North Korea rejects South's aid offer, calls President Yoon 'really simple'
subtitle: North Korea has rejected South Korea's offer of economic support in exchange for denuclearization, saying the proposal suggests President Yoon Suk Yeol is "really simple," state media KCNA reported Friday.
content: has rejected South Korea's offer of economic support in exchange for denuclearization, saying the proposal suggests President  is "really simple,"state media KCNA reported Friday.Kim Yo Jong, a top official and the sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, criticized Yoon's offer to improve North Korea's economy and the livelihood of its people as "pipedream-like remarks." Yoon first proposed what he called an to swap economic cooperation for an end to North Korea's nuclear program during his inauguration speech in May. He has since continued to raise the idea, reiterating the offer this week.In a speech Monday, he said his government would implement a large-scale food program, provide help for power generation, enhance agriculture, and other measures to modernize North Korea's ports, trade routes, hospitals and economy in exchange for denuclearization.But in the KCNA report, Kim Yo Jong rejected the proposal and leveled personal attacks at the South Korean President."To think that the plan to barter 'economic cooperation' for our honor, nukes, is the great dream, hope and plan of Yoon, we came to realize that he is really simple and still childish," said Kim Yo Jong, according to KCNA. "We make it clear that we will not sit face to face with him."South Korea's Unification Ministry responded on Friday, expressing "strong regret" over Kim Yo Jong's "disrespectful comments." It said North Korea had "distorted our ideas and mentioned its intention to continue nuclear development instead of responding to the audacious initiative," adding that such an attitude would not only threaten peace on the Korean Peninsula but worsen North Korea's own economic situation.In the KCNA report, Kim Yo Jong also said South Korea had pinpointed the wrong location for missiles that North Korea launched on Wednesday, and questioned why the South and the United States had not released their analysis of the weapons. The isolated hermit kingdom launched  from the coastal town of Onchon into waters off its west coast on Wednesday, according to the South Korean military.But Kim Yo Jong claimed the test had been conducted from the Kumsong Bridge in Anju city, located in South Pyongan Province, just north of the capital Pyongyang. She did not give further details of the test.Wednesday's test marks North Korea's 18th missile launch this year, according to CNN's count.By comparison, the hermit kingdom conducted only four tests in 2020, and eight in 2021.Tensions between the two Koreas have been building this year, with US military and intelligence agencies warning that North Korea appears to be preparing for a nuclear test -- which would be its first in five years.
